metadata.name: First Click
metadata.description:
Robert Young | Hong Kong | 2008

"Arriving in Hong Kong in 2008 was a dream come true. I never met my grandfather but always wondered about his homeland. I was finally getting to see it first hand. It was simply incredible!

On August 25, 2008, I took an escalator ride on the 'Centralâ€“Mid-Levels Escalator,' the longest outdoor covered escalator system in the world. After only traveling about halfway up, I got off, walked along a path and came across the vision that would become "First Click." 

I had purchased a DSLR camera to master composition for my film work, but as I looked down at the digital display, I saw something I had not seen before in my images... I saw a work of art. 

'First Click' was born. 

It's only fitting, 14 years later, that my first digital fine art photograph is now my first minted NFT." Robert Young
